alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 11:50PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Choctaw, western Washington, northwestern Clarke, George, southeastern Perry, eastern Wayne, Greene and eastern Stone Counties through 1245 AM CST... At 1150 PM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Snell to 12 miles east of McHenry. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Lucedale, Butler, Leakesville, Clara, Lisman, Millry, McLain, State Line, Buckatunna, Silas, Fruitdale, Pennington, Gilbertown and Toxey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CST for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
